sen.j: 人参代往古丁銀（にんじんだいおうこちょうぎん）とは宝永7年（1710年）から、高麗人参貿易取引専用に鋳造された丁銀の一種で秤量銀貨である。
sen.e: Ninjindai Oko Chogin is a silver coin minted from 1710 for exclusive use in the import of Korean ginseng and it belongs to the category of coin in which its value is determined by weight of silver.
Ninjindai Oko Chogin refers to silver coins minted from 1710 for exclusive use for trade of Korean ginseng, and it was a silver-by-weight standard.
sen.cmt: is を refers toに変更、the importをtradeに変更、秤量銀貨を用語集の用語に変更しました。
sen.e: Ninjindai Oko Chogin refers to silver coins minted from 1710 for exclusive use for trade of Korean ginseng, and it was a silver-by-weight standard.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 対応する豆板銀は鋳造されず、人参代往古銀（にんじんだいおうこぎん）あるいは単に往古銀（おうこぎん）また人参丁銀（にんじんちょうぎん）とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: Mameitagin which also belonged to the same category with this coin was not minted; it is also called as Ninjindai Okogin or merely Okogin or Ninjin Chogin.
Mameitagin (one of Edo-period coins) which corresponded to this coin was not minted, and Ninjindai Oko Chogin is also called Ninjindai Okogin or merely Okogin or Ninjin Chogin.
sen.cmt: 「対応する」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Mameitagin (one of Edo-period coins) which corresponded to this coin was not minted, and Ninjindai Oko Chogin is also called Ninjindai Okogin or merely Okogin or Ninjin Chogin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この「往古」は慶長丁銀の品位への復帰を意味する。
sen.e: This 'Oko' mean restoration of the purity of Keicho Chogin (a silver oval coin minted in the early Edo period).
The term 'Oko' means restoration of the grade of Keicho Chogin (a silver oval coin minted in the early Edo period).
sen.cmt: 冒頭を「the term」に変更、動詞meanを三人称単数形に変更しました。Purityを用語集に従ってgradeに変更しました。
sen.e: The term 'Oko' means restoration of the grade of Keicho Chogin (a silver oval coin minted in the early Edo period).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 表面には、「寳」字および大黒図柄が打たれ、その極印は宝永四ツ宝丁銀のものと同一であるが、「宝」字などの年代印は無く、品位は慶長丁銀と同一である。
sen.e: On its surface the coin has the Chinese character (ho, treasure) and an effigy of the god of wealth, Daikoku, a reference to Joze DAIKOKU, the head of the coin-making place and the hallmark is the same as that of Hoei Yotsuho Chogin (the silver coin minted since 1711); however, it has no seal of the Chinese character such as '宝' which is the name of the era in which the coin minted; the purity is the same as that of Keicho Chogin.

The coin has a Chinese character of 寳 (pronounced as ho, which means treasure) and an effigy of the god of wealth named Daikoku on its surface, and its hallmark is the same as that of Hoei Yotsuho Chogin (the silver coin minted since 1711); however, it has no seal of a Chinese character which represents the era name such as '宝,' and the grade of this coin is the same as that of Keicho Chogin.
sen.cmt: 「on its surface」の位置を変更、不要な語句の削除。Purityを用語集に従ってgradeに変更しました。
sen.e: The coin has a Chinese character of 寳 (pronounced as ho, which means treasure) and an effigy of the god of wealth named Daikoku on its surface, and its hallmark is the same as that of Hoei Yotsuho Chogin (the silver coin minted since 1711); however, it has no seal of a Chinese character which represents the era name such as '宝,' and the grade of this coin is the same as that of Keicho Chogin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸時代初期、優れた薬効があり高価であった高麗人参は日本国内で栽培することができず、もっぱら朝鮮半島からの輸入に頼り、この貿易は対馬藩が担当し決済は慶長丁銀で行われていた。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, Japanese people did not have the knowledge of glowing Korean ginseng, which had excellent beneficial effect used as a medicine and that which was expensive; therefore, the supply depended solely on the import from the Korean Peninsula; Tsushima clan (present Tsushima City, Nagasaki Prefecture and a part of Saga Prefecture) was in charge of this trade and the settlement was done by Keicho Chogin.

As Japanese people did not have knowledge about how to grow Korean ginseng, which was expensive because it had excellent beneficial effect used as a medicine in the early Edo period, its supply depended solely on the import from the Korean Peninsula, and the Tsushima Domain was in charge of this trade and the settlement was done by Keicho Chogin.
sen.cmt: 語順を変更し不要なセミコロンや副詞を削除、対馬藩はTsushima Domainに訂正しました。
sen.e: As Japanese people did not have knowledge about how to grow Korean ginseng, which was expensive because it had excellent beneficial effect used as a medicine in the early Edo period, its supply depended solely on the import from the Korean Peninsula, and the Tsushima Domain was in charge of this trade and the settlement was done by Keicho Chogin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元禄8年（1695年）9月に貨幣吹替え（改鋳）が行われ、品位が低下した元禄丁銀が発行された際、この吹替えのことを朝鮮側に伝えず、対価支払い用には依然良質な慶長銀を確保して支払いに充てていたが、やがて慶長丁銀の確保が困難となり、一旦人参貿易が打ち切られた。
sen.e: In September of Genroku 8 (1695) reminting of currency was done and Genroku Chogin with low silver content was issued; at that time Tsushima clan did not inform this reminting to Korea and continued to pay the cost for Korean ginseng with Keicho Chogin with good quality; however, gradually it became difficult for Tsushima clan to secure Keicho Chogin; thereupon, the trade of Korean ginseng was cut off by the Korean side; after that the clan negotiated with the Korean side for two years and in May of Genroku 12 (1699) the agreement between two sides was made in which the clan agreed to pay Korea adding 27% of the price besides to the stated price when the clan paid with Genroku Chogin.

When reminting of currency was done and Genroku Chogin with low silver content was issued in October 1695, the Tsushima Domain did not inform Korea of this reminting and continued to pay for Korean ginseng with Keicho Chogin with good quality; however, it gradually became difficult for the Tsushima Domain to secure Keicho Chogin, so the trade of Korean ginseng was terminated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。元禄8年（1695年）9月の変換を修正、語順を変更して不要なセミコロンを削除、対馬藩はTsushima Domain
sen.e: When reminting of currency was done and Genroku Chogin with low silver content was issued in October 1695, the Tsushima Domain did not inform Korea of this reminting and continued to pay for Korean ginseng with Keicho Chogin with good quality; however, it gradually became difficult for the Tsushima Domain to secure Keicho Chogin, so the trade of Korean ginseng was terminated.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 対馬藩の朝鮮側との2年越しの交渉の末、元禄12年（1699年）5月に、元禄銀による支払いは、慶長銀の2割7分増しで決済することで合意がなされた。
sen.e: Afterward, the domain negotiated with the Korean side for two years, and in May 1699, they agreed that the domain should pay additional 27% of the price besides to the stated price when the domain would pay with Genroku Chogin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。全体的に書き換えました
sen.e: Afterward, the domain negotiated with the Korean side for two years, and in May 1699, they agreed that the domain should pay additional 27% of the price besides to the stated price when the domain would pay with Genroku Chogin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 含有銀量で換算すれば2割5分増しであるが、これは元禄銀の品位を分析した結果、含有率が規定量に満たないなどの申し出が朝鮮側からあったなどのやり取りによるものであった。
sen.e: If the exchange is to be done using the silver content, addiction of the 25% of the stated price is proper; the reason this agreement was made with the addition of 27% was that Tsushima clan received the statement from the Korean side in which Korean side pointed out that the result of analyzing the purity of the coins received the percentage of silver content did not meet the defined amount and so forth.

Considering the amount of contained silver, 25% of the stated price was a proper additional amount, but the reason why this agreement was made was that the Tsushima Domain received a report from the Korean side in which they found out the percentage of silver content did not meet the defined amount after their analysis of the grade.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました。Purityを用語集に従ってgradeに変更しました。
sen.e: Considering the amount of contained silver, 25% of the stated price was a proper additional amount, but the reason why this agreement was made was that the Tsushima Domain received a report from the Korean side in which they found out the percentage of silver content did not meet the defined amount after their analysis of the grade.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、宝永3年（1706年）に丁銀の品位はさらに下げられ、宝永丁銀による取引も純銀量に応じて割増すことで取引を試みたが、低品位であったことに加え、天候不順などによる人参の収穫高の低下などの背景から交渉は決裂し、対馬藩は再び取引中止を朝鮮側から通告された。
sen.e: However, in Hoei 6 (1706) the purity of Chogin was further lowered; Tsushima clan tried to negotiate with the Korean side by paying additional payment according to the purity of the silver content; however, along with the low purity of the coin, the amount of ginseng harvested fell because of the bad weather; for these reasons the negotiation fell apart and Tsushima clan received a notice of termination of the trade from the Korean side again.

However, in 1706 the grade of Chogin was further lowered, and the Tsushima Domain tried to negotiate with the Korean side by paying additional payment according to the grade of the silver content; however, along with the low grade of the coin, the amount of ginseng harvested fell because of the bad weather, and so the negotiation fell apart and the Tsushima Domain received a termination notice of the trade from the Korean side again.
sen.cmt: 元号の削除、余分なセミコロンの削除、clanをdomainに修正。Purityを用語集に従ってgradeに変更しました。
sen.e: However, in 1706 the grade of Chogin was further lowered, and the Tsushima Domain tried to negotiate with the Korean side by paying additional payment according to the grade of the silver content; however, along with the low grade of the coin, the amount of ginseng harvested fell because of the bad weather, and so the negotiation fell apart and the Tsushima Domain received a termination notice of the trade from the Korean side again.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 対馬藩の申し出により宝永7年（1710年）9月27日、幕府は銀座 (歴史)に対し人参取引専用に慶長銀と同品位の丁銀を鋳造することを命じた。
sen.e: In Hoei 7 (1710), the Shogunate ordered to Ginza (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of silver coins during the Edo period) to mint the silver coin which has the same purity with that of Keichogin to be used for the sole purpose of importing Korean ginseng; it was because the Shogunate received a request from Tsushima clan.

Responding to the request from the Tsushima Domain, the Shogunate ordered Ginza (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of silver coins during the Edo period) to mint silver coins which had the same grade as that of Keichogin, exclusively for the ginseng trade, in 1710.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました
sen.e: Responding to the request from the Tsushima Domain, the Shogunate ordered Ginza (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of silver coins during the Edo period) to mint silver coins which had the same grade as that of Keichogin, exclusively for the ginseng trade, in 1710.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これが人参代往古丁銀であるが、「往古」とは復帰するという意味である。
sen.e: This is Ninjindai Oko Chogin; 'Oko' means to return; however, it is said that Tsushima clan did not use this name in dealing with the Korean people for importing Korean ginseng and used the name 'Tokuchugin' (the silver coin minted for special purposes) to avoid misunderstanding for Genrokugin by Korean side; that is, people in Tsushima clan did not want to be thought by the Korean side that payment up to that point was intentionally made by using the low quality silver coin.
This was Ninjindai Oko Chogin, and the term 'oko' meant return.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。
sen.e: This was Ninjindai Oko Chogin, and the term 'oko' meant return.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これまでの元禄銀による支払いは故意に悪質の銀貨を渡していたとの誤解を避けるため、対馬藩では貿易取引において「特鋳銀（とくちゅうぎん）」と称したという。
sen.e: It is said that the Tsushima Domain did not use this name in the trade and used another name 'Tokuchugin' (the silver coin minted for special purposes) to avoid misunderstanding for Genrokugin by Korean side; that is, the Tsushima Domain did not want the Korean side to think that payments up to that point was intentionally made by using low quality silver coins.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。藩はclanではなくdomainに修正、余分な語句の削除、that is 以下が冗長なので修正
sen.e: It is said that the Tsushima Domain did not use this name in the trade and used another name 'Tokuchugin' (the silver coin minted for special purposes) to avoid misunderstanding for Genrokugin by Korean side; that is, the Tsushima Domain did not want the Korean side to think that payments up to that point was intentionally made by using low quality silver coins.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 人参代往古銀はすべて京都の銀座において鋳造され、吹元銀は佐渡金山、生野銀山、および石見銀山の灰吹銀であった。
sen.e: Every Ninjindai Okogin was minted in Ginza in Kyoto; The primary material of these coins was cupellated silver of Sado Gold Mine, Ikuno Silver Mine and Iwami Silver Mine.
Every Ninjindai Okogin was minted in Ginza in Kyoto, and the primary material of these coins was cupellated silver of Sado Gold Mine, Ikuno Silver Mine and Iwami Silver Mine.
sen.cmt: 不要なセミコロンの削除しました。
sen.e: Every Ninjindai Okogin was minted in Ginza in Kyoto, and the primary material of these coins was cupellated silver of Sado Gold Mine, Ikuno Silver Mine and Iwami Silver Mine.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『銀座書留』によれば宝永7年（1710年）より1年当り1,417貫500匁の人参代往古銀を対馬藩に渡すように記している。
sen.e: According to "Ginza Kakitome" (Record of Ginza), it is arranged as the Shogunate was to hand Tsushima clan 1,417 kan 500 monme per year for the cost of Ninjindai Oko Chogin since Hoei 7 (1710).

According to "Ginza Kakitome" (The Record of Ginza), the Shogunate was to hand the Tsushima Domain 1,417 kan (one kan is approximately 3.75 kg) 500 monme (one monme is approximately 3.75 g) of Ninjindai Oko Chogin per year from 1710.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の追加、貫や匁の説明の追加、「藩」の訳の訂正、元号の削除しました。
sen.e: According to "Ginza Kakitome" (The Record of Ginza), the Shogunate was to hand the Tsushima Domain 1,417 kan (one kan is approximately 3.75 kg) 500 monme (one monme is approximately 3.75 g) of Ninjindai Oko Chogin per year from 1710.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、正徳 (日本)4年（1714年）に品位を慶長銀に復帰させた正徳丁銀を発行した際、人参代往古銀の鋳造の必要はなくなり中止された。
sen.e: Afterwards, in Shotoku 4 (1714) Shotoku Chogin was issued; in this silver coin, purity of Keicho Chogin was restored; accordingly, minting of Ninjindai Oko Chogin was abolished as it was no longer needed; however, Tsushima clan was still waiting for Ninjindai Oko Chogin allocated for Shotoku 3 (1713) to come from the Shogunate after this reminting; it was because although Shotoku Chogin was good quality, the hallmark differed from that of Ninjindai Oko Chogin; therefore, Tsushima clan thought to pay with Shotoku Chogin would hinder the trade and petitioned the Shogunate repeatedly for Ninjindai Oko Chogin to be delivered to Tsushima clan and finally the clan received the coin, that the clan had been receiving regularly up to that time, in Shotoku 4 (1714).
Afterwards, in 1714, Shotoku Chogin, whose grade was the same as the one of Keicho Chogin, was issued, and accordingly, minting of Ninjindai Oko Chogin was abolished as it was no longer needed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました元号の削除、余分はセミコロンを削除して文章の構造を修正。Purityを用語集に従ってgradeに変更。
sen.e: Afterwards, in 1714, Shotoku Chogin, whose grade was the same as the one of Keicho Chogin, was issued, and accordingly, minting of Ninjindai Oko Chogin was abolished as it was no longer needed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: が、この正徳の改鋳後も対馬藩はまだ、正徳3年（1713年）分の往古銀を受け取っておらず、正徳銀は良質とはいえ極印が異なることから交易に差し支えるとして陳情に努め、正徳4年（1714年）7月にようやく従来の往古銀を受け取った。
sen.e: However, the Tsushima Domain still did not receive Ninjindai Oko Chogin allocated for the year of 1713 after this reminting, and they thought paying with Shotoku Chogin would hinder the trade because the hallmark differed from that of Ninjindai Oko Chogin although Shotoku Chogin was good quality, and therefore, they petitioned the Shogunate repeatedly for Ninjindai Oko Chogin to be delivered to the Tsushima Domain and they finally received the coin in 1714.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました余分なセミコロンを削除し文章の構造を変更しました。その他「対馬藩」の訳語などの誤りを修正しました。
sen.e: However, the Tsushima Domain still did not receive Ninjindai Oko Chogin allocated for the year of 1713 after this reminting, and they thought paying with Shotoku Chogin would hinder the trade because the hallmark differed from that of Ninjindai Oko Chogin although Shotoku Chogin was good quality, and therefore, they petitioned the Shogunate repeatedly for Ninjindai Oko Chogin to be delivered to the Tsushima Domain and they finally received the coin in 1714.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元文元年（1736年）に再び品位の低下した元文丁銀が発行された際、往古銀の鋳造が再開された。
sen.e: When Genbun Chogin with the silver content of inferior purity was issued in Genbun 1 (1736), minting of Ninjindai Oko Chogin was resumed.
When Genbun Chogin with the silver content of inferior grade was issued in 1736, minting of Ninjindai Oko Chogin was resumed.

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかしこの頃から、徳川吉宗による殖産興業の一環として進められた政策により高麗人参の国内栽培が可能となり、人参代往古銀の鋳造は衰退した。
sen.e: However, from around that time domestic cultivation of Korean ginseng was enabled as a part of policy in which new industry is encouraged by Yoshimune TOKUGAWA; consequently, minting of Ninjindai Okogin declined.

However, from around that time domestic cultivation of Korean ginseng became enabled as a part of policy in which new industry is encouraged by Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, and consequently, minting of Ninjindai Okogin declined.

tit.j: 人参代往古銀の鋳造量
tit.cmt: mintedの頭文字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 宝永年間から正徳丁銀発行までの京都の銀座における鋳造高は5,337貫156匁4分（20.00トン）であり、この内、対馬藩に渡された丁銀は5,197貫500匁（19.47トン）である。
sen.e: The amount minted during the period from Hoei era to the time in which Shotoku Chogin was issued was 5,337 kan 156 momme 4 bu (20.00 ton). Out of this amount, Chogin that went to Tsushima clan was 5,197 kan 500 momme (19.47 ton).
The amount of the coin minted from the Hoei era to the time when Shotoku Chogin was issued was 5,337 kan 156 momme 4 bu (20.00 ton).
sen.cmt: ピリオドで区切られる文章が2つあるため、「一原文一訳文の例外対処」とします。不要な語句の削除しました。
sen.e: The amount of the coin minted from the Hoei era to the time when Shotoku Chogin was issued was 5,337 kan 156 momme 4 bu (20.00 ton).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 渡高の内訳は宝永7年（1710年）分が945貫、正徳元年（1711年）、2年（1712年）、3年（1713年）はそれぞれ規定額の1,417貫500匁であったが受け渡しは1～2年遅れるのが常であった。
sen.e: The breakdown of the amount delivered to Tsushima clan was as follows: Hoei 7 (1710): 445 kan; Shotoku 1 (1711), Shotoku 2 (1712), Shotoku 3 (1713): the stipulated amount of 1,417 kan 500 momme respectively; however, delivery and receiving was always delayed one to two years.

The breakdown of the amount delivered to the Tsushima Domain was 445 kan in 1710 and the stipulated amount of 1,417 kan 500 monme in 1711, 1712, and 1713, but delivery was always delayed one or two years.
sen.cmt: 元号の削除、不要なコロンやセミコロンの削除、「対馬藩」の訳の修正しました。
sen.e: The breakdown of the amount delivered to the Tsushima Domain was 445 kan in 1710 and the stipulated amount of 1,417 kan 500 monme in 1711, 1712, and 1713, but delivery was always delayed one or two years.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 公儀灰吹銀から丁銀を吹きたてる場合の銀座の収入である分一銀（ぶいちぎん）は渡された灰吹銀に対する3%と設定された。
